Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2015 03:24PM y1981m wrote: After speaking with my gynecologist's office regarding my continued symptoms and asking to have the cyst aspirated they have referred me to a breast surgeon. Unfortunately, he can't see me until July 7. I'm trying my best not to worry and continue with life as normally as possible the next few weeks. Things will be fine until I get an itch or pain in my breast and then I feel the panic wash over me. Any ideas on what to expect at my appointment? I truly appreciate all the wisdom that has been shared with me on this board. Thank you!
Posts.Title: Am I being paranoid or do I need to pursue this? y1981m art15

Posts.Content: y1981m wrote: Nearly 3 weeks ago I found a lump in my left breast. The next night I had intense burning/itching near my areola on the same breast. Three days later my gynecologist conducted a clinical breast exam. She was certain it was a cyst but ordered a diagnostic bilateral mammogram and ultrasound.Last week I went in for the tests, they also did digital tomosynthesis which I believe is a 3D mammogram. I was beyond relieved when the radiologist came in and told me that based on both exams he was confident I had a single 2cm cyst. My gynecologist called me later that day to confirm the radiologist's interpretation. The cyst is still there. I have symptoms in my left breast ranging from itching, a sunburned feeling, pain, fullness and a feeling similar to let down when I was breastfeeding may years ago. These sensations come and go. I'm 33 years old, two children, no family history. What should I do? I'm concerned this is more than "just a cyst". Should I get it aspirated? Am I making something out of nothing? Thank you! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Am I being paranoid or do I need to pursue this? y1981m art15

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2015 04:00PM y1981m wrote: I wanted to thank everybody for their input. My gut feeling often gets hijacked by my anxiety so I struggle with discerning what is actual cause for concern sometimes. I posted my question on the John Hopkins "Ask an Expert" board as well and the response was that my symptoms are most likely caused by the cyst and/or hormonal shift. That being said, I will be contacting my doctor on Monday to request an aspiration. From what I have read the appearance of the fluid would let the doctor know if a biopsy was needed, correct?
